                           <span class="break-words">

                             <!-- -->
                             This sets the ground for AGI.

                             </span>

                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Evolutionary Model Merge uses evolutionary techniques toautomaticallycreatenewfoundation models with the desired capabilities.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             "We find that our approach is able to automatically discover novel ways tomergedifferent models from vastly different domains"
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             They even used this method to evolve 3 powerful foundation models for Japan:
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Large Language Model (EvoLLM-JP)
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Vision-Language Model (EvoVLM-JP)
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Image Generation Model (EvoSDXL-JP)
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             "Surprisingly, we find that both models achieve state-of-the-art results on several LLM and Vision benchmarks, while not being explicitly optimized to be good at these benchmarks!"
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Link in bio.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Are you technical? Check out
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                              <!-- -->
                              https://AlphaSignal.ai
                              <!-- -->
                             </a>
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 170,000+ engineers and researchers.
                             <!-- -->
                            </span>
                           </span>

                           <span>

                        <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                         <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                           <!-- -->
                           <span class="break-words">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span dir="ltr">
                             <!-- -->
                             Big news. Google just introduced a method to steal model information from black-box production language models like ChatGPT or PaLM-2.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             "Our attack extracts the entire projection matrix of OpenAI's Ada and Babbage language models. We thereby confirm, for the first time, that these black-box models have a hidden dimension of 1024 and 2048, respectively."
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             They focus on the model's embedding projection layer, which is the last layer of the model. This layer is responsible for translating the internal representations of data (the "hidden dimensions") into a format that the model can use to make predictions or generate text.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Link in comments.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Are you technical? Check out
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                              <!-- -->
                              https://AlphaSignal.ai

                        <h2 class="visually-hidden">
                         Feed post
                        </h2>
                        <div class="update-components-actor display-flex update-components-actor--with-control-menu">
                         <!-- -->
                         <div class="update-components-actor__container pr4 display-flex flex-grow-1">
                          <a aria-label="Lior S., graphic." class="app-aware-link update-components-actor__image relative" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">

                        <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                         <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                           <!-- -->
                           <span class="break-words">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span dir="ltr">
                             <!-- -->
                             Big news. Google just introduced a method to steal model information from black-box production language models like ChatGPT or PaLM-2.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             "Our attack extracts the entire projection matrix of OpenAI's Ada and Babbage language models. We thereby confirm, for the first time, that these black-box models have a hidden dimension of 1024 and 2048, respectively."
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             They focus on the model's embedding projection layer, which is the last layer of the model. This layer is responsible for translating the internal representations of data (the "hidden dimensions") into a format that the model can use to make predictions or generate text.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Link in comments.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Are you technical? Check out
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                              <!-- -->
                              https://AlphaSignal.ai
                              <!-- -->
                             </a>
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 170,000+ engineers and researchers.
                             <!-- -->
                            </span>
                           </span>

                     <div class="full-height">
                      <div class="feed-shared-update-v2 feed-shared-update-v2--minimal-padding full-height relative feed-shared-update-v2--e2e artdeco-card" data-urn="urn:li:activity:7176246899010625536" id="ember156" role="region">
                       <div>
                        <div role="status">
                         <!-- -->
                        </div>
                        <h2 class="visually-hidden">
                         Feed post
                        </h2>
                        <div class="update-components-header update-components-header--with-control-menu update-components-header--with-divider update-components-header--with-image t-12 t-black--light t-normal pt2">
                         <div class="update-components-header__text-wrapper">
                          <!-- -->
                          <a class="app-aware-link" data-control-id="fvyTfBidPWtSxA5xC2dvBg==" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">
                           <div class="ivm-image-view-model update-components-header__image mr2">
                            <div class="ivm-view-attr__img-wrapper display-flex">
                             <!-- -->
                             <img alt="Liors profile photo" class="ivm-view-attr__img--centered EntityPhoto-circle-0 evi-image lazy-image ember-view" height="24" id="ember157" loading="lazy" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5603AQG9NK0CAgKtVg/profile-displayphoto-shrink_100_100/0/1687301791875?e=1717027200&amp;v=beta&amp;t=MvIwbKWucu7yJP6Fs8tmtyI13J6Z4WQmbD4l41A1z6U" width="24"/>
                            </div>
                           </div>
                          </a>
                          <span class="update-components-header__text-view">
                           <span>
                            <a class="ember-view" href="/in/liorsinclair/" id="ember158">

                        <div class="feed-shared-control-menu display-flex feed-shared-update-v2__control-menu absolute text-align-right">
                         <!-- -->
                         <div class="artdeco-dropdown artdeco-dropdown--placement-bottom artdeco-dropdown--justification-right ember-view" id="ember160">
                          <button aria-expanded="false" aria-label="Open control menu for post by Damien Benveniste, PhD" class="feed-shared-control-menu__trigger artdeco-button artdeco-button--tertiary artdeco-button--muted artdeco-button--1 artdeco-button--circle artdeco-dropdown__trigger artdeco-dropdown__trigger--placement-bottom ember-view" id="ember161" tabindex="0" type="button">
                           <svg aria-hidden="true" class="artdeco-button__icon" data-supported-dps="16x16" data-test-icon="overflow-web-ios-small" height="16" role="none" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                            <!-- -->
                            <use height="16" href="#overflow-web-ios-small" width="16">
                            </use>
                           </svg>
                           <!-- -->

                           <a aria-label="3d    " class="app-aware-link update-components-actor__sub-description-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/damienbenveniste?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAAT2LbsB3xS0kxwoZu8TsNvAXS5jonOKqiw" target="_self">
                            <span class="update-components-actor__sub-description t-12 t-normal t-black--light">
                             <span aria-hidden="true">
                              <!-- -->
                              3d 
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <span>
                                <li-icon aria-hidden="true" class="v-align-bottom" size="small" type="globe-americas">
                                 <svg class="mercado-match" data-supported-dps="16x16" fill="currentColor" focusable="false" height="16" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                                  <path d="M8 1a7 7 0 107 7 7 7 0 00-7-7zM3 8a5 5 0 011-3l.55.55A1.5 1.5 0 015 6.62v1.07a.75.75 0 00.22.53l.56.56a.75.75 0 00.53.22H7v.69a.75.75 0 00.22.53l.56.56a.75.75 0 01.22.53V13a5 5 0 01-5-5zm6.24 4.83l2-2.46a.75.75 0 00.09-.8l-.58-1.16A.76.76 0 0010 8H7v-.19a.51.51 0 01.28-.45l.38-.19a.74.74 0 01.68 0L9 7.5l.38-.7a1 1 0 00.12-.48v-.85a.78.78 0 01.21-.53l1.07-1.09a5 5 0 01-1.54 9z">
                                  </path>
                                 </svg>
                                </li-icon>
                               </span>
                              </span>
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              <!-- -->
                             </span>
                             <span class="visually-hidden">
                              <!-- -->
                              3d 
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                             </span>
                            </span>
                           </a>
                          </div>
                         </div>
                         <button aria-label="Follow Damien Benveniste, PhD" aria-live="polite" class="follow update-components-actor__follow-button update-components-update-v2__follow-button artdeco-button artdeco-button--tertiary" type="button">
                          <svg aria-hidden="true" class="artdeco-button__icon" data-supported-dps="16x16" data-test-icon="add-small" height="16" role="none" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                           <!-- -->
                           <use height="16" href="#add-small" width="16">
                           </use>
                          </svg>
                          <span aria-hidden="true">
                           Follow
                          </span>
                         </button>
                         <!-- -->
                        </div>
                        <!-- -->
                        <!-- -->
                        <!-- -->
                        <!-- -->
                        <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                         <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                           <!-- -->
                           <span class="break-words">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span dir="ltr">
                             <!-- -->
                             Augmenting LLMs with databases is great, but there are major flaws in that approach! We see a lot of debates around fine-tuning versus Retriever Augmented Generation (RAG) with LLMs these days. Augmenting LLMs with small additional data is better served by RAG, but it is important to understand the shortcomings of that approach!
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             The idea with RAG is to encode the data you want to expose to your LLM into embeddings and index that data into a vector database. When a user asks a question, it is converted to an embedding, and we can use it to search for similar embeddings in the database. Once we found similar embeddings, we construct a prompt with the related data to provide context for an LLM to answer the question. Similarity here is usually measured using the cosine similarity metric.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             The first problem is that a question is usually not semantically similar to its answers. At least, it is possible for the search to retrieve documents containing the same words as the question or that are used in the same context without providing relevant information to answer the question. Because the search retrieves the most similar documents to the question, depending on the data, too many irrelevant documents may show higher cosine similarity than the documents actually containing the answer.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             To be fair, high cosine similarity does not exactly translate to semantic similarity with Transformers. High cosine similarity can also capture the high co-occurrence of 2 different terms within the same sub-text of the training data, which often happens for a specific question and its related answer.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Another problem may be related to the way the data has been indexed. If the data have been broken down into big chunks of text, then it is likely to contain multiple different and unrelated information within each chunk. If you perform a similarity search on that data, the pertinent information may be diluted, and the search may return irrelevant documents instead. It is important to break down the data so that each chunk contains no more than a few paragraphs to ensure more "uniqueness" in the concepts developed in each text.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             With the RAG approach, it is very important to limit the type of questions we ask the LLM. If we ask questions that require aggregating data all over the database, the answers are most likely going to be wrong, but the LLM won't be able to know that. If the right information is local to one or a few documents, a similarity search may find it. However, if the information requires scanning all the documents to find the answer, a similarity search won't find it. Imagine each document is dated, and we ask, "What is the earliest document?". In that case, we can only know the answer if we scan the entire database, and a similarity search won't be helpful.
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             --
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                              Don't forget to subscribe to my ML newsletter:
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://lnkd.in/g4iKyRmS" target="_self">
                              <!-- -->
                              https://lnkd.in/g4iKyRmS
                              <!-- -->
                             </a>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             --
                             <!-- -->
                            </span>
                           </span>
                          </div>

                           <span>
                            see more
                           </span>
                          </button>

                 </li>
                 <li class="profile-creator-shared-feed-update__container">
                  <div>
                   <div class="relative">
                    <div class="profile-creator-shared-feed-update__anchor">
                    </div>
                    <div class="full-height">
                     <div class="full-height">
                      <div class="feed-shared-update-v2 feed-shared-update-v2--minimal-padding full-height relative feed-shared-update-v2--e2e artdeco-card" data-urn="urn:li:activity:7175543696363286528" id="ember188" role="region">
                       <div>
                        <div role="status">
                         <!-- -->
                        </div>

                        <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                         <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                           <!-- -->
                           <span class="break-words">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span dir="ltr">
                             <!-- -->
                             Is Cosine-Similarity of Embeddings Really About Similarity? Apparently not.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Researchers from Netflix observed that blindly using cosine similarity for semantic similarity between learned embeddings can generate meaningless results.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Cosine-similarity is the cosine of the angle between two vectors, or equivalently the dot product between their normalizations.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Paper in comments.
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             
                             <!-- -->
                             <span>
                              <br/>
                             </span>
                             <!-- -->
                             Are you technical? Check out
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                              <!-- -->
                              https://AlphaSignal.ai
                              <!-- -->
                             </a>
                             <span class="white-space-pre">
                             </span>
                             to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 170,000+ engineers and researchers.
                             <!-- -->
                            </span>
                           </span>
                          </div>
                          <button aria-label="see more, visually reveals content which is already detected by screen readers" class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text__see-more-less-toggle see-more t-14 t-black--light t-normal hoverable-link-text" role="button" type="button">
                           <span>
                            see more
                           </span>
                          </button>

                         </div>

                     <div class="full-height">
                      <div class="full-height">
                       <div class="feed-shared-update-v2 feed-shared-update-v2--minimal-padding full-height relative feed-shared-update-v2--e2e artdeco-card" data-urn="urn:li:activity:7175526045708619776" id="ember685" role="region">
                        <div>
                         <div role="status">
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>
                         <h2 class="visually-hidden">
                          Feed post
                         </h2>
                         <div class="update-components-header update-components-header--with-control-menu update-components-header--with-divider update-components-header--with-image t-12 t-black--light t-normal pt2">
                          <div class="update-components-header__text-wrapper">
                           <!-- -->
                           <a class="app-aware-link" data-control-id="RAYXp5Eu4B/Z8oTuUaS0kg==" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">
                            <div class="ivm-image-view-model update-components-header__image mr2">
                             <div class="ivm-view-attr__img-wrapper display-flex">
                              <!-- -->
                              <img alt="Liors profile photo" class="ivm-view-attr__img--centered EntityPhoto-circle-0 evi-image lazy-image ember-view" height="24" id="ember686" loading="lazy" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5603AQG9NK0CAgKtVg/profile-displayphoto-shrink_100_100/0/1687301791875?e=1717027200&amp;v=beta&amp;t=MvIwbKWucu7yJP6Fs8tmtyI13J6Z4WQmbD4l41A1z6U" width="24"/>
                             </div>
                            </div>
                           </a>
                           <span class="update-components-header__text-view">
                            <span>
                             <a class="ember-view" href="/in/liorsinclair/" id="ember687">
                              <!-- -->
                              Lior S.
                              <!-- -->
                             </a>
                            </span>
                            <span class="white-space-pre">
                            </span>
                            reposted this
                            <!-- -->
                           </span>
                          </div>

                             <span class="update-components-actor__sub-description t-12 t-normal t-black--light">
                              <span aria-hidden="true">
                               <!-- -->
                               5d 
                               <span class="white-space-pre">
                               </span>
                               <span>
                                <span>

                                </span>

                               <!-- -->

                          <button aria-label="Follow Damien Benveniste, PhD" aria-live="polite" class="follow update-components-actor__follow-button update-components-update-v2__follow-button artdeco-button artdeco-button--tertiary" type="button">
                           <svg aria-hidden="true" class="artdeco-button__icon" data-supported-dps="16x16" data-test-icon="add-small" height="16" role="none" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                            <!-- -->

                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              What are the best companies to apply your Machine Learning skills? There are many aspects to consider, but I believe one very important one is the maturity of the ML effort.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              I see 3 clear classes of companies out there:
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              - Those that have no clue about ML: this is most of the corporate world! ML has definitively no impact on revenue, and the leaders have no idea how to extract value from ML. They dont have the right data, they dont have the right applications, they dont have the right data infrastructure, they dont have the right people. Those companies might be a sweet spot for consultants or maybe people with an entrepreneurial mindset. A newcomer in such an organization will need to wear many engineering hats, be an AI advocate, be an AI salesperson, argue for the right budget allocation, and lead projects without much belief from their peers It can be fun, but it will be exhausting, and the most simple trivial steps will be a challenge, especially in a big company where the inertia is high! If you are not an entrepreneur, you will be bound to work on low-impact and low-scale projects that will not help you to grow much as an ML expert.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - The companies that are on the way to becoming successful with ML: I think we are seeing more and more of those types of companies nowadays. The leaders understood the value of ML, and a good budget is allocated to the effort. Usually, a sizable piece of current or future revenue is bet on ML. A clear proxy to recognize those companies is how much they are investing in MLOPs. They are thinking about feature stores, ML monitoring, the tight coupling between the serving pipeline and the training pipeline, the data needed for continuous updates of the models, or future ML development endeavors. I think those companies are a sweet spot for generalists. The systems are immature enough that you will need to wear multiple hats. You will be able to think about new ML products alongside the ML system design, data engineering pipelines, or the right ML algorithms. You probably wont have time to think too much about the latest algorithm as there might be lower-hanging fruits to grab first.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - The mature companies in ML: those are basically the FAANGs and similar big tech companies. ML is an integral part of the revenue, and the MLOPs are bleeding edge. Think about Google; it is the biggest ad tech (== ML) company in the world! Those companies might be a sweet spot for the specialists. In those companies, you will focus on very specialized problems with very specialized tools. You will not be able to think about data engineering alongside ML development. You will be able to implement the latest algorithms at scale and work closely with R&amp;D departments. The infrastructures, the teams, or the scales of the data in general are huge in those companies, and there is a real inertia in doing anything. It is harder to move fast, as it is in a startup.
                              <!-- -->
                             </span>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <button aria-label="see more, visually reveals content which is already detected by screen readers" class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text__see-more-less-toggle see-more t-14 t-black--light t-normal hoverable-link-text" role="button" type="button">
                            <span>
                             see more
                            </span>
                           </button>
                           <!-- -->
                          </div>
                          <!-- -->
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>

                 <li class="profile-creator-shared-feed-update__container">
                  <div>
                   <div class="relative">
                    <div class="profile-creator-shared-feed-update__anchor">
                    </div>
                    <div class="ember-view occludable-update" id="ember221">

                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              Big news. Grok is finally open-source. With 314 billion parameters, it's the largest open LLM ever built.  It outperforms LLaMa 2 and Mixtral on MMLU.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Grok's MMLU score of 73% beats Llama 2 70Bs 68.9% and Mixtral 8x7Bs 70.6%.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Trained on the entirety of twitter, it's a Mixture-of-Experts model that activates 25% of weights for each forward pass, giving a total of 80B active parameters.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Github repo in comments.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Are you technical? Check out
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                               <!-- -->
                               https://AlphaSignal.ai
                               <!-- -->
                              </a>
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 170,000+ engineers and researchers.
                              <!-- -->
                             </span>
                            </span>

                    <div class="ember-view occludable-update" id="ember223">
                     <div class="full-height">
                      <div class="full-height">
                       <div class="feed-shared-update-v2 feed-shared-update-v2--minimal-padding full-height relative artdeco-card" data-urn="urn:li:activity:7174799770950008832" id="ember651" role="region">
                        <div>
                         <div role="status">
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>
                         <h2 class="visually-hidden">
                          Feed post
                         </h2>
                         <div class="update-components-header update-components-header--with-control-menu update-components-header--with-divider update-components-header--with-image t-12 t-black--light t-normal pt2">
                          <div class="update-components-header__text-wrapper">
                           <!-- -->
                           <a class="app-aware-link" data-control-id="1U8b8H6Nc75UuLH2PFWoTQ==" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">
                            <div class="ivm-image-view-model update-components-header__image mr2">

                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">

                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              The first AI software engineer is here and it's going to change everything.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>

                              Devin is a new model that can complete jobs on Upwork, pass interviews at top AI companies, and excel at the SWE-Bench coding benchmark.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>

                              It's an autonomous agent that solves engineering tasks through the use of its own shell, code editor, and web browser.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              When evaluated on the SWE-Bench benchmark, which asks an AI to resolve GitHub issues found in real-world open-source projects, Devin correctly resolves 13.86% of the issues unassisted, far exceeding the previous state-of-the-art model performance of 1.96% unassisted and 4.80% assisted.

                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              The first AI software engineer is here and it's going to change everything.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Devin is a new model that can complete jobs on Upwork, pass interviews at top AI companies, and excel at the SWE-Bench coding benchmark.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              It's an autonomous agent that solves engineering tasks through the use of its own shell, code editor, and web browser.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              When evaluated on the SWE-Bench benchmark, which asks an AI to resolve GitHub issues found in real-world open-source projects, Devin correctly resolves 13.86% of the issues unassisted, far exceeding the previous state-of-the-art model performance of 1.96% unassisted and 4.80% assisted.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Link in comments.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Are you technical? Check out
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                               <!-- -->
                               https://AlphaSignal.ai
                               <!-- -->
                              </a>
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 175,000+ engineers and researchers.

                            <a aria-label="1w    " class="app-aware-link update-components-actor__sub-description-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/damienbenveniste?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAAT2LbsB3xS0kxwoZu8TsNvAXS5jonOKqiw" target="_self">
                             <span class="update-components-actor__sub-description t-12 t-normal t-black--light">
                              <span aria-hidden="true">
                               <!-- -->
                               1w 
                               <span class="white-space-pre">
                               </span>
                               <span>
                                <span>
                                 <li-icon aria-hidden="true" class="v-align-bottom" size="small" type="globe-americas">
                                  <svg class="mercado-match" data-supported-dps="16x16" fill="currentColor" focusable="false" height="16" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                                   <path d="M8 1a7 7 0 107 7 7 7 0 00-7-7zM3 8a5 5 0 011-3l.55.55A1.5 1.5 0 015 6.62v1.07a.75.75 0 00.22.53l.56.56a.75.75 0 00.53.22H7v.69a.75.75 0 00.22.53l.56.56a.75.75 0 01.22.53V13a5 5 0 01-5-5zm6.24 4.83l2-2.46a.75.75 0 00.09-.8l-.58-1.16A.76.76 0 0010 8H7v-.19a.51.51 0 01.28-.45l.38-.19a.74.74 0 01.68 0L9 7.5l.38-.7a1 1 0 00.12-.48v-.85a.78.78 0 01.21-.53l1.07-1.09a5 5 0 01-1.54 9z">
                                   </path>
                                  </svg>
                                 </li-icon>
                                </span>
                               </span>
                               <span class="white-space-pre">
                               </span>
                               <!-- -->
                               <!-- -->
                              </span>
                              <span class="visually-hidden">
                               <!-- -->
                               1w 
                               <span class="white-space-pre">

                           </div>
                          </div>
                          <button aria-label="Follow Damien Benveniste, PhD" aria-live="polite" class="follow update-components-actor__follow-button update-components-update-v2__follow-button artdeco-button artdeco-button--tertiary" type="button">
                           <svg aria-hidden="true" class="artdeco-button__icon" data-supported-dps="16x16" data-test-icon="add-small" height="16" role="none" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
                            <!-- -->
                            <use height="16" href="#add-small" width="16">
                            </use>

                           <span aria-hidden="true">
                            Follow
                           </span>
                          </button>
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>
                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <!-- -->
                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              What happens if your Machine Learning model breaks? Imagine if the Netflix movie ranking model, the Facebook feed ranking model, or the Google search engine model suddenly stopped working. Nothing would show on those websites! Would that be an acceptable user experience?
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              In reality, those websites are extremely reliable! To run any of them, thousands of microservices or databases are always running in the background, and some of them are doomed to crash from time to time. In many cases, we can make the systems fault-tolerant by adding redundancy.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              This doesn't always work for ML pipelines! Suddenly, your model can start to output unusable predictions or errors. Those predictions may be widely inaccurate or simply non-numerical values. If a prediction request fails, it may be due to some hardware failure, in which case redundancy could solve the problem. It could also be due to bugs that have been introduced due to the way a specific feature is computed, which would lead to any redundant model failing as well. It is often important to have fallback strategies in place to handle this kind of situation. A fallback model could be a previous version of the production model, a simpler model, or a simple heuristic rule that outputs sub-optimal predictions but predictions nonetheless. If a request fails, you can have a retry step with exception handling that re-routes the request to a fallback model.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              It is quite easy to detect failures when a model throws errors or non-numerical values, but it is much harder when the model seemingly predicts meaningful values. That is why it is always important to monitor input features and model outputs. If some feature statistics start to drastically change over time, you may want to temporarily disable any model feeding on that feature and re-route requests to simpler models not using the feature, or you could simply replace the feature value with a constant while you investigate. Similarly, your prediction statistics, the model calibration, or the online model performance could start shifting, in which case you need to make sure your monitoring system automatically enables re-routing of the requests to a different model.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Fallback mechanisms become critical in big tech companies. You may have hundreds of engineers working on separate aspects of the ML pipelines, testing different techniques to improve those pipelines. Multiple engineers may deploy a new model, a new feature, a new feature transformation, or a new optimization technique that may lead to the pipelines suddenly failing. The monitoring system may detect outlier behavior but it may take days to debug the problem, and it is often easier to revert to a previous state of the pipelines until the problem is resolved.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Reliability for ML systems can be tricky, and it is important to adopt ML-specific strategies to handle it!
                              <!-- -->
                             </span>
                            </span>
                           </div>
                           <button aria-label="see more, visually reveals content which is already detected by screen readers" class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text__see-more-less-toggle see-more t-14 t-black--light t-normal hoverable-link-text" role="button" type="button">
                            <span>
                             see more
                            </span>
                           </button>
                           <!-- -->
                          </div>
                          <!-- -->
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>

                    <div class="ember-view occludable-update" id="ember231">
                     <div class="full-height">
                      <div class="full-height">
                       <div class="feed-shared-update-v2 feed-shared-update-v2--minimal-padding full-height relative artdeco-card" data-urn="urn:li:activity:7172981056877391873" id="ember533" role="region">
                        <div>
                         <div role="status">
                          <!-- -->
                         </div>
                         <h2 class="visually-hidden">
                          Feed post
                         </h2>
                         <div class="update-components-actor display-flex update-components-actor--with-control-menu">
                          <!-- -->
                          <div class="update-components-actor__container pr4 display-flex flex-grow-1">
                           <a aria-label="Lior S., graphic." class="app-aware-link update-components-actor__image relative" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">
                            <span class="js-update-components-actor__avatar">
                             <div class="ivm-image-view-model update-components-actor__avatar">
                              <div class="ivm-view-attr__img-wrapper display-flex">
                               <!-- -->
                               <img alt="" class="ivm-view-attr__img--centered EntityPhoto-circle-3 update-components-actor__avatar-image evi-image lazy-image ember-view" height="48" id="ember534" loading="lazy" src="https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D5603AQG9NK0CAgKtVg/profile-displayphoto-shrink_100_100/0/1687301791875?e=1717027200&amp;v=beta&amp;t=MvIwbKWucu7yJP6Fs8tmtyI13J6Z4WQmbD4l41A1z6U" width="48"/>
                              </div>
                             </div>
                            </span>
                           </a>
                           <div class="update-components-actor__meta relative">
                            <a aria-label="View: Lior S.    Following Covering the latest in AI R&amp;amp;D  ML-Engineer  Ex-Mila researcher  MIT Lecturer  Building AlphaSignal.ai, a technical newsletter read by 170,000 AI/ML experts." class="app-aware-link update-components-actor__meta-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/liorsinclair?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADMTPYsBtfLtDZlCPxc0G4n0-rFYtqhC0yE" target="_self">
                             <span class="update-components-actor__title">
                              <span class="update-components-actor__name hoverable-link-text t-14 t-bold t-black">
                               <span dir="ltr">
                                <span aria-hidden="true">
                                 <!-- -->
                                 Lior S.
                                 <!-- -->
                                </span>
                                <span class="visually-hidden">
                                 <!-- -->
                                 Lior S.
                                 <!-- -->
                                </span>
                               </span>
                              </span>
                              <span class="update-components-actor__supplementary-actor-info t-black--light t-14 t-normal">
                               <span aria-hidden="true">
                                <span class="white-space-pre">
                                </span>
                                <!-- -->
                                <!-- -->
                                <span>

                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">
                          <div class="feed-shared-inline-show-more-text feed-shared-update-v2__description feed-shared-inline-show-more-text--minimal-padding" tabindex="-1">
                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              Elon just announced something big. Grok will become open source this week.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              This is happening days after he sued OpenAI for abandoning its original mission in favor of a for-profit model.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              xAIreleased Groklast year, its features includes access to real-time information and information that countered politically correct views.
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Grok TLDR:
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - Grok has real-time access to tweets from X
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - It will have a "live" search engine connected to X.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - It already surpasses GPT3 on some benchmarks
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - 25,000 char. context window
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - Can handle multi-tasking/chat
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - Image/Audio recognition APIs are planned
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              - Will run natively in Teslas
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Are you technical? Check out
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              <a class="app-aware-link" data-test-app-aware-link="" href="https://AlphaSignal.ai" target="_self">
                               <!-- -->
                               https://AlphaSignal.ai
                               <!-- -->
                              </a>
                              <span class="white-space-pre">
                              </span>
                              to get a weekly summary of the latest models, repos and papers in AI. Read by 170,000+ engineers and researchers.

                         <div class="feed-shared-update-v2__description-wrapper mr2" style="" tabindex="-1">

                           <div class="update-components-text relative update-components-update-v2__commentary" dir="ltr">
                            <!-- -->
                            <span class="break-words">
                             <!-- -->
                             <span dir="ltr">
                              <!-- -->
                              Is localhost dead? Daytona, a new repo trending in Github, lets you set up development environments across any infrastructure with a single command.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              It's a radically simple open source development environment manager.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Features:
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              -Single command activation for fully configured development environments.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              -Supports local, remote, cloud-based, and virtual machine infrastructures.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              -Extensive configuration file support, including DevFile and Nix.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              -Integrated IDE support for VS Code and JetBrains locally.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              -Enables secure connections with automatic VPN and reverse proxy integration.
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <span>
                               <br/>
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                              Link in comments
                              <!-- -->
                              <span>

                               </use>
                              </svg>

                               Repost
                              </span>
                              <!-- -->
                             </button>

                              <!-- -->
                             </div>

                              <svg aria-hidden="true" class="rtl-flip" data-supported-dps="24x24" data-test-icon="send-privately-medium" height="24" role="none" viewbox="0 0 24 24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

                               <!-- -->
                              </span>
                             </span>
                            </a>
